content:
The Reds

You join the town as they gathered around, gawking at the statue in front of the town assembly hall. A single red star stared back at them from the brim of Columbus' hat. Reds? In your town? No time to contact the federal government, this must be stopped now, by the hot blood of the citizens!

Rules:
1) All site rules apply.
2) If the game is in progress, don't mention it!
3) Play to win.
4) Enjoy yourself; others may follow your example.
5) All text must be readily readable, in legible script, and fully visible. No encrypted or otherwise coded text.
6) I have the final say in all matters. Questions may be PMed to me or bolded @me in-thread.
7) Do not quote any PM sent by me to you that regards this game. Paraphrasing is fine.
8) Do not discuss this game anywhere else, unless specifically cleared by me.
9) Prods will be issued at 48 hours of inactivity in the thread. Prods not responded to within 24 hours and players with more than 2 prods will be replaced at my discretion.
10) Bolded Blue is my color as moderator. Do not us it!
11) Vote by using either the 'bold' or 'vote' tags. Abbreviated names can be used. Votes should be on their own line, seperated from other text. If I think its a vote for a player then its a vote; if I do not then it is not! Please be clear!
12) A lynch will occur as soon as a player receives majority votes. Players may talk until the thread closes.
13) Days will last 14 days and nights 2 days.
14) Please spoiler large(r) images and keep in mind that mobile and low speed users will have difficulty accessing the game if it gets spammed with large images and youtube videos. Added after game start


Spoiler: Sample Role PM
You are a Vanilla Town.
You have the right to speak and vote for players.
You win when all threats to the town are eliminated.
Confirm your role by PMing me its name.

PMs have been sent out. Game will begin when 9/13 players comfirm, Or (expired on 2015-04-25 12:00:00).

Day 1 Starts now!

@MonkeyMan: He's played at other sites before, this is how I know.

@Terrador: You tell me then how everyone thinks you're scum all the time

Oh hey, I forgot. I'm also an SE in this game, which means I am "Semi-Experience Challenged". It just means that I've played a few games on site. As an SE, I do my best to be helpful and answer questions from newer players. When I'm talking about theory and such, that's simply me discussing a game which I've enjoyed for decades. You shouldn't read my alignment either way based upon any theory posts I make.

Also, as a PSA: The general rule of behavior on site is attack the play, not the player. This means that if you get irritated at someone in the game, it's okay to criticize their play or posts, but when you cross the line and attack the actual player, you are breaking the rules. Most folks on site are okay with some level of back and forth and breaking of this rule. There tends to be a "grow thicker skin" sort of attitude about it. I tend to believe that civil play benefits everyone. I won't start any fights, but if someone starts getting out of line, I will go hard at them. If you come at me personally, be prepared to pull back a stump. If you go after a newbie, be prepared to lose more than one limb. You've been warned.

{Serious bizness mode off}
Pisskop got us an SE for this game. That's above and beyond.
...Something tells me that was meant for a newbie game.
Dammit ... that was totally in notepad for a newbie game I'm in for SE. *sigh*.
I find it highly doubtful that he's "always scum", unless he has a small sample set of games.
But if you want to list every game he's been in and his alignment I'm open to hear it.

Kind of lost at the moment. Just warning you all. Lol. I need to go back and figure out what just happened. I'll be back later tonight.



As far as I'm concerned, RVS doesn't end until everyone gets in a good "I hate you too buddy" vote.

I can definitely sheep feeling hesitant about Drixx. Jumping to take credit for starting town discussion seems... desperate, and not in a way justified by RVS. @Drixx:
-As town, how often do you find yourself mislynched?
-When does a mislynch on you happen, typically? Early, towards endgame, or too spread out to characterize?

Dragonspawn also stood out to me as an early scumspect. He considers Keybladewielder's vote change (so clearly unsubstantiated that it can only be RVS) to be scum behavior, yet a similar vote from VictorDeAngelo (which should seem more suspicious, given a "why are we even discussing this" comment and placed on a townread of Dragonspawn's) gets the most cursory reply. Further, his attack on TheSoldier seems strange to me. Keybladewielder claimed it as RVS, and TheSoldier not going to death tunnel someone with an explanation for behavior less than twelve hours into D1.

UNVOTE
VOTE: Dragonspawn

@Dragonspawn, I have a few questions for you.
-How would you characterize Drixx's townplay?
-Do you have scumplay from Drixx to contrast that with?

@Keybladewielder, we are starting to generate content now. Would you agree that there's enough to at least start discussion? Kindly do so. You run the risk of characterizing yourself as more scummy than you are with continued erratic behavior.

@Monkeyman has done nothing wrong yet. I'm certainly not afraid of an RVS wagon, especially since I know TheSoldier is personally both very bright and at least moderately experienced. I've got a couple of questions for you, if you don't mind.
-What, traditionally, are behaviors and attitudes you see as representing town and/or scum intent?
-Have you played with anyone in this game before?

@TheSoldier, I've got a question or two for you, as well.
-How confident are you in your potential ability to read my alignment?
-I've heard tell of your game with Thor, where you eventually predicted that he was scum--but do you have any games where you rolled scum, or where you were a prominent participant in a mislynch as town?

Terrador wrote:@Monkeyman has done nothing wrong yet. I'm certainly not afraid of an RVS wagon, especially since I know TheSoldier is personally both very bright and at least moderately experienced. I've got a couple of questions for you, if you don't mind.
-What, traditionally, are behaviors and attitudes you see as representing town and/or scum intent?
-Have you played with anyone in this game before?


Town = Working with others, willing to think outside your own paradigm/thought process, general activity/engagement.
Scum = Only interested in your own opinions/theories, Not willing to change your mind, lurking/lack of activity.

I've played with keybladewielder and pisskop, though it's been awhile since I've played with keybladewielder.

While you are correct that some content has been made, it's not enough for me to put out anything meaningful yet that isn't pointless drabble.

To say something useful, even a small point, is better than to post a wall of text of absolute pointlessness.

@Monkeyman, I assume you consider tunneling to be suspicious? Does it continue being suspicious when the player has other reads and listens to other players, but still tunnels down?

@Keybladewielder, in that event, do you have some small content to make? Even if it's on game philosophy--what you generally consider scummy/townie?

Are both of you really trying to drum up a wagon on me for making an obvious joke in #38?

#66 looks an awful lot like someone wants to run the game; only question is whether that's a good thing or a bad thing. I guess we'll see.

Still waiting for TS to reply to #54. Terrador picks up some scum points for ignoring it and pretending like my joke in the 2nd line of #38 was at all serious. It's nearly as bad as that flashwagon we had.

VOTE: Terrador

Someone told me that I didn't use my vote enough to show who I was suspecting and that I should use my vote more. So you get a vote instead of just me saying I find you scummy. Go thank whomever it was who told me that. It's in one of my completed games.

What I consider to be scummy is any behavior that makes me suspicious. I don't have any defined point of "scumminess" or "towniness" - I read and analyze a post, then decide if it fits one side or the other.

Terrador wrote:
In post 69, Terrador wrote:@Monkeyman, I assume you consider tunneling to be suspicious? Does it continue being suspicious when the player has other reads and listens to other players, but still tunnels down?


Tunneling isn't necessarily suspicious, if the tunneler has good reason to tunnel. It's suspicious during certain circumstances, like if there is substantial disagreement, or if the tunnellee is low haning fruit, etc.

@Drixx, it's very early, and my vote isn't even on you. If you see a wagon, that's your paranoia, not ours. I would very much like you to answer my questions, as well. Further, with regards to my "ignorance" of #54--yes, I understand that the content of that post wasn't important. The tone still stuck out to me, though.

I would like to play decisively, yes. Asking questions, making reads--these are things people do in this game! I'd like to not just sheep sheep sheep along; being competent is a thing I aspire to. Would you consider that part of your scumread on me?
@Keybladewielder, in that event, can you direct me to a post in a finished game of yours where you case someone who turns out to be scum?

In post 74, Terrador wrote:@Keybladewielder, in that event, can you direct me to a post in a finished game of yours where you case someone who turns out to be scum?

I disagree. Really good townies want to have a little scummy to them. Not so much that they disrupt the game about it, but if someone is so townie that they are basically conftown, then that draws the night kill. That's fine for VTs but VTs have a lot of methods to draw night kills. If you draw a PR you don't want to draw the NK, and being too obviously town makes you a target. You also need something consistent in your town game and you can't be super easy to read as town every time you get VT but then suddenly obviously playing differently if you draw a PR.

The idea that townies never want to appear a bit scummy is just like remedial level mafia theory.

@Drixx: Except there's a lot more to the night kill than shooting at confirmed town. There's also fishing for PRs (which is in itself its own metagame where a player may be particularly conspicuous to suggest they aren't the PR), mindgaming townies (shooting someone who was tunneling a townie hard with a case that looks good to encourage a mislynch), et cetera.

Dragonspawn does have a point here. Wagons with no resistance to them obviously mean that there's no one sticking up for the wagonee. I'm still scumreading Drixx nonetheless. He's obviously played before, and knows that wagons form in rvs for pointless things. The thing is, he should rationally know that if you adequately respond, the wagon will evaporate; just look at what happened to MonkeyMan's attempt to wagon me. Riabi is correct, the first part is re: The Binding of Isaac. The second, however, is just a joke between TheSoldier and I. We crack wise about various stupid things a fair bit, including that I have to out him as "my gay lover" now and again. That post is in no way, shape, or form, game-relevant. It is neither a crumb nor a claim for masonry, nor any other claim of outside contact.

Speak of the devil, I might as well speak my mind re: entirely pointless posts, heretofore referred to as shitposting. I have no objections to it, in and of itself--it lightens up a game and is generally too much fun to not do in such a serious setting. However, I am very firm on keeping shitposts and content separate; you should never see a joke in my content posts, and you shouldn't ever see content in my shitposts. That said, shitposting and failing to produce content? I know it isn't necessarily a scumtell, especially Day 1, but showing off that you're reading and not making content always feels suspicious. From a meta perspective, I like the shitpost/content dichotomy for eroding the shelter of "I was joking/it was sarcastic" as a potential backpedal; if the player is someone who does this, that defense will stop flying.

@VictorDeAngelo: Regardless of alignment, your tone towards Keyblade is uncalled for. It's entirely reasonable to think "hrm, dude hasn't posted besides prodge in a week, he probably shouldn't be playing". Yes, Keyblade was wrong, and maybe his tone was a tad abrasive or condescending there... But that statement is in no way an attack on you! At worst, it's an incorrect (but reasonable for Keyblade's understanding of your activity) attack on your demonstrated willingness to play the game, which really has just about zero bearing on you as a person--and, mind, Keyblade corrected the post literally right after! If you think that it's okay to spit acid at a player, surely it's reasonable for me to expect you to grow a thicker skin--people will question your play, your logic, and sometimes (by lynch or by suggested/requested moderator action) your presence in the game. It is quite literally what you signed up for.

If you're going to be playing the game, I, for one, expect that you're going to be sportsmanlike to the other players. I fully understand how frustrating a misrepresentation or other poorly-constructed post attacking you can be, but I hope we can expect to not see a post like that again.

Ladies and germs, it's time for an Ill-Advised Late-Night Post!

First and foremost: I'd like to say that my opinion on Drixx has not really changed. There is some chance of this changing if his upcoming novella really is spectacularly protown, but given that he's at L-3 and we're what, three or four days from deadline? I'm comfortable having my vote here:

---

Alright, I want to look at MonkeyMan and Zerediah nobody else because wow this part of the post took forty-five minutes? Time flies. And by "a moment" I mean "stay up unreasonably late doing this". I AM GOING TO HAVE A FUN DAY TOMORROW, THANK YOU CAFFEINE.

MonkeyMan: I can wholeheartedly sheep TheSoldier's sentiments about Monkey having easy scumreads. The easiest wagon in the game, the astronaut (AKA Lapsa), and an inexperienced semi-lurker? Seems a bit much. He has a brief fight with VictorDeAngelo, but fails to mention him later, except for a backhanded implication that he's scum. Interesting, given that he doesn't talk about him. This doesn't really conform to what I would expect of a scumfight, nor a townie's treatment of a scummy person. On the off chance that my read on this is right, not such hopeful PoE (re: that interaction) for MonkeyMan here, eh?

Of Lapsa, he says that he generally wouldn't like to lynch him Day 1 without a better target--yet, as early as #171, he says he would be down with a Lapsa lynch. I don't know about y'all, but I'm generally of the belief that being inconsistent with how they approach game theory (this holds more for established/experienced players; I don't consider it nearly as telling for folks getting into game/site meta) hints at scum intent. His #244 corroborates the idea that he would be cool with a Day 1 Lapsa lynch, what with my lack of response to me asking if there's a different implied timetable. If I was being asked if I supported a Day 1 policy wagon and I didn't, I would get out from under that shit immediately, especially given that MonkeyMan may have a history of being mislynched. I think his treatment of Lapsa suggests scum intent.

This post is downright awful; he's attacking the credibility of TheSoldier (who looks pretty damn credible to me; in interests of full disclosure, I'm personally aware that he's a very competent fellow) immediately, and only later piecing together a response... and not a strong one, either (see the first quote of this post). Further, his #596 is jumping the gun a bit. After saying the scumteam is trying to lynch you, immediately after his vote on you, I'd say it's an entirely reasonable interpretation to consider that a scumread. And instead of ever really defending yourself, you just dismiss it as a scumwagon. Pretty classic scum move to discredit the player, not the play, honestly.

Finally, I could read a Drixx and MonkeyMan scumteam as being wholly consistent. Drixx himself said he expected to be lynched Day 1 from roughly the 36 hour mark, and MonkeyMan's limp onto the wagon is not exactly a pro post. My only possible utility would be somehow changing people's minds and successfully finding scum (MonkeyMan, Kitty and Lapsa are the three likeliest scum at the moment, in my opinion). The downside to me staying alive is gigantic. I'm easy lynchbait and I'll never be killed by scum. The worst possible scenario would be me doing too good a job and somehow staying alive today but remaining suspected all game and ending up in LYLO.

The best move for the town, for a ton of good reasons, is for me to be lynched today. Since we have time, I'm using it to try and leave what good I can. Lapsa - Repeated lies. Trying to appear like some kind of mad prophet or something. Seems to be trying the "too obviously weird to be scum" approach.

You don't know me very well, so I won't hold this against you. I'll simply tell you my philosophy of integrity, which I've always applied to online interactions because they are no less "real" than ones out in the meatworld. It takes you your entire life to build your integrity. It takes only a single instance to lose it. Lying in mafia as scum is a given. Lying as a townie is only acceptable for very specific reasons and should only be done by people skilled enough to do it properly. If you aren't sure, you shouldn't. Lying about putting together an evaluation of people is just never worthwhile or ethically acceptable.

If someone cannot be trusted to be honest and keep his integrity in such little things as a forum mafia game, then how can he possibly be trusted when it comes to truly important things like his marriage, his job, and other important things? The only answer is that he cannot. You will not always be able to trust that I'm being honest about game specific things, because this is a game that has lying as a basic element of the game. You can always trust me to be honest about what I'm doing out in meatworld.

It is generally considered poor form to question what someone says about what they have going on in real life or what they're doing out in real life. It's also exceptionally poor form for scum to make up things about real life to try and gain sympathy. Any player who will give up being trusted long term for a chance at maybe surviving and maybe winning a mafia game ... well, I think you can all figure out what I would say about such a player.

Theories concerning Night 1

I can’t imagine scum bypassing a night kill. I might be wrong about that, but that’s my working assumption. That being said, here are some of the possible scenarios:

1. Mankeyman died from a vigilante kill. Soldier is the vigilante who was caught by dragonspawn, a tracker, in the act. Meanwhile the scum kill was preempted by a doctor or some other role blocker. (For the record, I am NOT calling for anyone to claim here.)

2. Mankeyman was killed by scum, and dragonspawn caught Solkier in the act.

3. Moneyman was killed by scum. Dragonspawn, as scum, falsely claiming Tracker, points out Soldier (also scum, who could then claim vig) in order to give both of them town credibility.

4. Monkeyman was NK’ed by Soldier the SK. Scum NK was thwarted.

5. Dragonspawn is a scum tracker who caught Soldier (either SK or vig) in his night action. Scum NK was thwarted.

If anyone can come up with other scenarios, I’m all ears.

Each theory has problems:

For #1 to be true, we have to believe that dragonspawn, against the odds selected with his very first post in the game the one person who would have a successful night action, while at the same time, some other town person, again against the odds, chose the one person the scum had targeted for the night kill. Despite the long odds, this might be the most plausible explanation.

#2 Makes no sense for a mafia NK. Monkeyman was likely to be mislynched. He also claimed vanilla which means the scum would bypass him for an NK in hopes of finding a PR instead.

The problem with #3 is that it’s an awfully ballsy gambit to make. But it explains why there was only one night kill, and why dragonspawn crumbed Soldier on the first post. Dragonspawn voted Soldier I know, but Soldier could easily claim vigilante, so the vote was no threat. But the vote was needed as the means of getting the false claims out there. I can’t believe dragonspawn would automatically assume scum and not consider vigilante. And his proposal that a Monkeyman NK makes sense for the scum to throw the town into chaos is not at all plausable.

#4 How this would make sense depends on the thought process of the SK in selecting Monkeyman. And of course I don’t know what that would be. Again we would have to assume the scum NK was thwarted, and dragon got lucky on his tracker selection.

$5 The problem with this theory is that the scum might want to keep their tracker’s find secret and take the vig out with a NK. For once a vig is forced to claim, town is unlikely to lynch and the vig might be protected by night.

Going forward: I’m not sure how to test dragonspawn’s tracker claim. But if Soldier is indeed town he should be willing to listen to suggestions from the town about whom to vig.

I like Random's analysis a lot. For the record, I think 1 is the most likely.

Also, maybe I'm wrong on how the role plays out, but, isn't scenario 1 a bit more likely if we consider the possibility of a bulletproof? Then, we don't have to assume the possibility that one PR picked the same player that scum picked. But just that scum picked a BP. I've never actually played a game with a BP, but I don't even think they'd know that they were targeted if that happened.

2. Mankeyman was killed by scum, and dragonspawn caught Solkier in the act.

3. Moneyman was killed by scum. Dragonspawn, as scum, falsely claiming Tracker, points out Soldier (also scum, who could then claim vig) in order to give both of them town credibility.

4. Monkeyman was NK’ed by Soldier the SK. Scum NK was thwarted.

5. Dragonspawn is a scum tracker who caught Soldier (either SK or vig) in his night action. Scum NK was thwarted.

If anyone can come up with other scenarios, I’m all ears.

Each theory has problems:

For #1 to be true, we have to believe that dragonspawn, against the odds selected with his very first post in the game the one person who would have a successful night action, while at the same time, some other town person, again against the odds, chose the one person the scum had targeted for the night kill. Despite the long odds, this might be the most plausible explanation.

#2 Makes no sense for a mafia NK. Monkeyman was likely to be mislynched. He also claimed vanilla which means the scum would bypass him for an NK in hopes of finding a PR instead.

The problem with #3 is that it’s an awfully ballsy gambit to make. But it explains why there was only one night kill, and why dragonspawn crumbed Soldier on the first post. Dragonspawn voted Soldier I know, but Soldier could easily claim vigilante, so the vote was no threat. But the vote was needed as the means of getting the false claims out there. I can’t believe dragonspawn would automatically assume scum and not consider vigilante. And his proposal that a Monkeyman NK makes sense for the scum to throw the town into chaos is not at all plausable.

#4 How this would make sense depends on the thought process of the SK in selecting Monkeyman. And of course I don’t know what that would be. Again we would have to assume the scum NK was thwarted, and dragon got lucky on his tracker selection.

$5 The problem with this theory is that the scum might want to keep their tracker’s find secret and take the vig out with a NK. For once a vig is forced to claim, town is unlikely to lynch and the vig might be protected by night.

Going forward: I’m not sure how to test dragonspawn’s tracker claim. But if Soldier is indeed town he should be willing to listen to suggestions from the town about whom to vig.

I feel that it's likely that at least one scum was on each of the main wagons. In other words, Victor and/or Terrador are scum based on this FMPOV.

This is all well and good, but VCA can be manipulated, right? Does Soldier have any non-VCA reasons to suspect these three? Why yes, as a matter of fact I do.

Spoiler: Terrador case
Most of my reasons here come from D2.
To begin with, I really really dislike how tentative he was about the dragon wagon 1105, 1108, etc.

In fact, 1108 has a somewhat interesting statement. He says that Dragonspawn is 'dirty as hell,' but on checking his ISO, I realized that he'd never explained why he was dirty other than the inconsistency, which he wasn't buying at that point.

1111 is also weird in that he's calling out Victor for wanting to consolidate with time left in the day, when D1 I felt he'd agreed with me that the halfway point of the deadline was when we should consolidate.

1119 was his piece of analysis that had him decide on the Dragon wagon, which was... pre-flip associatives with Keyblade? He doesn't want to put Dragon at L-1, not really sure why that is, but he later does anyway, citing low time (2 days). Pre-flip associatives are almost always terrible, and he should know that since the aforementioned "Blitz" incident was him tunneling hard on a townie based on these.

I really don't get the purpose of 1155. If you wanted Kitty to give you her read on Zerediah, why not just ask that instead of one that's pointless? Really, what kind of answer is he hoping for?

Basically, I think he was testing the waters of the Dragon wagon, only jumping on when it was clear that it was going through and he had an excuse for lynching a pr. I don't understand his reluctance to put people he thinks are scum at L-1 with the deadline halfway gone if he was town; I can easily see him doing it as cautious scum. His callout of Victor for trying to wrap things up shows that prematurely ending the day is in the front of his mind as a scummy action, and he doesn't want to do so himself because he's afraid of his image. Considering that he listed himself as a common townread, him being concerned about such things suggests a scum mindset.

Spoiler: Victor case
I hate his D2 entrance. He's far from the only person to conclude that I was a vig and not scum based on me killing Monkey, but the way he shoots down the idea of scum killing Monkey is just weird. Killing the guy that everyone's set on lynching throws everyone out of whack and can leave town floundering; I have seen scum do this before, and I don't know why people find it so unbelievable. Killing obvtown is almost certainly better, yes, but this is a game played by human beings. Nobody is perfectly optimal all the time; people might want to try new strategies or just confuse everyone.

Furthermore, voting Dragon because he said he followed me rather than tracking me is bad. I personally forgot that follower was even a role, and have seen people say that they followed someone as a tracker. Trying to portray Dragon as scummy for his word choice is awful, since him saying he followed someone when claiming tracker is in no way scummy.

Then we have 828. Zerediah has been encouraging people to vote Drixx. He has been supporting the Drixx wagon, while conspicuously avoiding actually voting there, for most of the day. Drixx had "given up" for most of the day, but towards the end of D1 Zerediah now thinks he's town because he gave up! This is scummy as hell, and indeed, Victor agreed that Zerediah was scummy D1. But now, when Slandaar asks him why he liked Zerediah's explanation D1, he says that it's because Zerediah was right about Drixx. Major problem: Zerediah and Victor couldn't have known he was right about Drixx until D2! Victor also doesn't say why he liked the post when it was posted, instead using knowledge he can't have had. This is damning. Victor gave an answer to a D1 question using D2 knowledge purposefully. Furthermore, it's D2 knowledge that only scum could have had D1.

Spoiler: Zerediah case
Zerediah is an utter goldmine. Everything Slandaar said about him still stands, for one thing.

Going all the way back to his first few posts, voting someone for "lurking" in the first real-life day of the game is horrible and when it took him a fair while to make his first post just seems highly unlikely to come from town.

Him saying that he wouldn't be hunting without Riabi's permission/request is also terrible, even taking into account language barrier.

I could see him saying that he gets better D2 as a ploy to not get lynched D1; I don't know what other games he's been in, so I can't say if his claim has any truth to it at all.

Slandaar's point about his lack of read continuity is best put in 1042. There's more; read Slandaar's ISO, it's not too long.

958 - 959 strikes me as panicky.

Finally, my bolded point in the Victor spoiler is somewhat applicable to Zerediah as well. Suddenly deciding that Drixx is town after saying he's scum most of the day is one thing. Saying he thinks Victor is scum and then, after two flips that have nothing to do with Victor, he completely drops him is not something that happens with townies.


tl;dr is that Victor and Zerediah/Prolapsed are both individually scummy, and if one flips scum the other is almost certainly scum too. What people consider balanced. Kitty was a perfect reason why large hoods usually have scum. If they can get cleared by their neighbors they can skate on by; and even get defended while doing so.
